channel.title: Firas' Personal Website
channel.description: Recent content on Firas' Personal Website

item.title: Producing figures for LaTeX documents with Gnuplot
item.description: It’s formatted as vector graphics : Vector graphics are more reliable when it comes to quality. Unless you use some trillions of pixels, a bitmap image turns very quickly into a mess when you zoom for details. Its Labels and axis graduations are effortlessly visible : This is important especially in slides for oral presentations. Graduations and labels must be clearly visible, otherwise the figure may lose its purpose. It blends well with the surroundings where it’s inserted : The figure should be in harmony with the text around it.

item.title: A very basic introduction to Hamilton's principle
Career
item.description: Education 2017-Dec 2020 - Université Paul Sabatier-Institut de Mathématiques de Toulouse: PhD in applied maths : An augmented Lagrangian approach for Euler-Korteweg type equations. A copy of my manuscript is available Here . 2016-2017 - Aix-Marseille Université: Master’s degree in Multiphase Flows, Energetics and Combustion. 2013-2016 - Ecole Nationale d’Ingénieurs de Tunis: National Diploma of Engineering in Modelling for Industry and Services. (MIndS) 2011-2013 - Institut Préparatoire aux Etudes d’Ingénieurs d’El Manar:
